intro: Podolepis divaricata, commonly known as the variable podolepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
